snippet: Not only do the commonly recommended tests not lower the death rate from the disease, they also expose women to unnecessary risk and should not be performed, a panel of medical experts said.
abstract: United States Preventive Task Force recommends against screening healthy women for ovarian cancer; experts say the tests do not lower the death rate from the disease, and they yield many false-positive results that lead to unnecessary operations with high complication rates; research is published in Annals of Internal Medicine.
lead_paragraph: Not only do the commonly recommended tests not lower the death rate from the disease, they also expose women to unnecessary risk and should not be performed, a panel of medical experts said.

headline.seo: Ovarian Cancer Screening Has No Benefit, Panel Says
headline.main: Ovarian Cancer Screenings Are Not Effective, Panel Says
headline.print_headline: Ovarian Cancer Screenings Have No Benefit, Panel Says, and Some Risks

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations
